sen.cmt: 罵るの訳を修正しました。妙見山はMt. Myokenとしました。
sen.e: Kawakami who was on Mt. Myoken with his men for the battle formation, tried to die heroically in Ikuno Town, but the farmers, who thought they had been deceived, got angry, execrated them as 'fake roshi' and attacked them.

sen.j: 河上ら13人の浪士は妙見山に戻って自刃して果てる。
sen.e: Kawakami and thirteen roshi returned to Mount Myoken and committed suicide by the sword.

sen.j: 美玉三平と中島太郎兵衛は農民に襲撃され射殺された。
sen.e: Sanpei MITAMA and Tarobee NAKAJIMA were attacked by the farmers and shot to death.

sen.j: 平野は兵を解散させると鳥取へ向かったが捕らえられ、京の六角獄舎へ送られる。
sen.e: Hirano dissolved the army and headed to Tottori, but he was caught and sent to Rokkaku prison house in Kyoto.

sen.j: その他の浪士たちも戦死、逃亡、捕縛された。
sen.e: The other roshi died, fled or were arrested.

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）7月の禁門の変の際に平野は幕吏によって六角獄舎で殺害された。
sen.e: In July 1864, Hirano was killed by a shogunate official in Rokkaku prison house, when the Hamaguri Rebellion (kinmon no hen) occurred.
In July 1864, Hirano was killed by a shogunate official in Rokkaku prison house, when the Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kimmon) occurred.
sen.cmt: 禁門の変の訳を単語リストに揃えました。

sen.j: 北垣国道は生き残り、維新後に京都府知事となっている。
sen.e: Kunimichi KITAGAKI survived and became the governor of Kyoto Prefecture after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 生野での挙兵はあっけなく失敗したが、この挙兵は天誅組の挙兵とともに明治維新の導火線となったと評価されている。
sen.e: Raising an army quickly failed, but this army as well as the army of Tenchugumi, are appraised for being a trigger for the Meiji Restoration.
